summary: A legal hold notice from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Office of the General Counsel, issued on August 14, 2019, instructing identified custodians to preserve all records and electronically stored information related to the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The notice anticipates litigation and outlines strict preservation requirements.

events.title: BOP Issues Legal Hold Notice
events.description: The Office of the General Counsel for the Federal Bureau of Prisons issues a legal hold notice (LHN-CIV-2019-00204) to preserve all records related to Epstein's death, anticipating litigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:30 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019, in an apparent suicide.
The Bureau of Prisons anticipated litigation related to Epstein's death and issued a formal legal hold notice on August 14, 2019, to preserve all relevant records.
The legal hold notice identifies specific BOP officials, Michael Albert Thomas and Tova A Noel, as custodians who must preserve electronic and physical documents.
The notice warns that knowingly altering or deleting relevant information could result in court sanctions or employment action against staff.
The document references specific BOP record systems like TRUSCOPE and BEHR that must be preserved.
